keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after threats of shooting up the airport were reported by his family.
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but had an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle parked outside the airport.

He faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in commission of a felony, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm.
Federal charges include attempted violence at an international airport, interstate communications containing threats to injure, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm.
Cagle, who lives in Cartersville, Georgia, was previously convicted of marijuana possession over two decades ago.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation.
Atlanta’s Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport is the world’s busiest airport and the hub for Delta Air Lines.
The incident was described as a 'tragedy averted' by Atlanta Police Chief Darin Schierbaum, due to early intervention by Cagle’s family.
The mayor, Andre Dickens, noted that Cagle had a semi-automatic weapon and was mentally challenged, which posed a deadly combination.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem praised law enforcement for preventing a potential mass casualty event.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Though not armed at the time of arrest, police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle parked outside. Cagle faces multiple state and federal charges, including terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assaults, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm. Authorities credit the incident being averted due to early warning from his family and inter-agency coordination. The FBI and federal prosecutors are involved, and officials emphasize the deadly combination of mental health challenges and firearm possession. The airport, the world’s busiest, is a critical global transportation hub, making this event a significant public safety concern with national implications.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to ‘Shoot It Up’
